title: Good enough for government work
author: VD
content_html:
DH notes the following scientific marvel:

French doctors are puzzling over the case of 44-year-old civil servant who has led a quite normal life — but with an extraordinarily tiny brain…. Scans by computed tomography (CT) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showed that the man’s cerebral cavities, called ventricles, had massively expanded.

“The brain itself, meaning the grey matter and white matter, was completely crushed against the sides of the skull,” Feuillet told AFP. “The images were most unusual… the brain was virtually absent,” he said.

Is any comment really necessary? I don’t think so.
content_text:
DH notes
the following scientific marvel
:
French doctors are puzzling over the case of 44-year-old civil servant who has led a quite normal life — but with an extraordinarily tiny brain….   Scans by computed tomography (CT) and magnetic resonance imaging (MRI) showed that the man’s cerebral cavities, called ventricles, had massively expanded.
“The brain itself, meaning the grey matter and white matter, was completely crushed against the sides of the skull,” Feuillet told AFP.  “The images were most unusual… the brain was virtually absent,” he said.
Is any comment really necessary?  I don’t think so.
